column2: We are old now, yet we were young this morning, when we carried our glass box through the streets of the City to the Home of the Scholars.
column3: We are old now, yet we were young this morning, when we carried our glass box through the streets of the City to the Home of the Scholars.

column2: No men stopped us, for there were none about [-from-] the Palace of Corrective Detention, and the others knew nothing.
column3: No men stopped us, for there were none about [-from ] the Palace of Corrective Detention, and the others knew nothing.

column2: No men stopped us at the gate.
column3: No men stopped us at the gate.

column2: We walked through {+the+} empty passages and into the great hall where the World Council of Scholars sat in solemn meeting.
column3: We walked through {plus the plus} empty passages and into the great hall where the World Council of Scholars sat in solemn meeting.

column2: We saw nothing as we entered, save the sky in the great windows, blue and glowing.
column3: We saw nothing as we entered, save the sky in the great windows, blue and glowing.

column2: Then we saw the Scholars who sat around a long table; they were as shapeless clouds huddled at the rise of [-the-] {+a+} great sky. There were {+the+} men whose famous names we knew, and others from distant lands whose names we had not heard.
column3: Then we saw the Scholars who sat around a long table; they were as shapeless clouds huddled at the rise of [-the ] {plus a plus} great sky. There were {plus the plus} men whose famous names we knew, and others from distant lands whose names we had not heard.

column2: We saw a great painting on the wall over their heads, of the twenty illustrious men who had invented the candle.
column3: We saw a great painting on the wall over their heads, of the twenty illustrious men who had invented the candle.

column2: All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered.
column3: All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered.

column2: These great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us, and they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity, as if we were a miracle.
column3: These great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us, and they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity, as if we were a miracle.

column2: It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with brown stains which had been blood.
column3: It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with brown stains which had been blood.

column2: We raised our right arm and we said:
column3: We raised our right arm and we said:

column2: Our greeting to you, our honored brothers of the World Council of Scholars!
column3: Our greeting to you, our honored brothers of the World Council of Scholars!

column2: Then Collective 0-0009, the oldest and wisest of the Council, spoke and asked:
column3: Then Collective zero-o o o nine, the oldest and wisest of the Council, spoke and asked:

column2: Who are you, our brother?	Who are you, our brother?
column3: true

column2: For you do not look like a Scholar."
column3: For you do not look like a Scholar."

column2: Our name is [-Equality-] {+Equity+} 7-2521, we answered, "and we are a Street Sweeper of this City."
column3: Our name is [-Equality ] {plus equity plus} seven minus two thousand five hundred twenty one, we answered, "and we are a Street Sweeper of this City."

column2: Then [-is-] {+it+} was [-as-] if a great wind had stricken the hall, for all the Scholars spoke at once, and they were angry and frightened.
column3: Then [-is ] {plus i t plus} was [-as ] if a great wind had stricken the hall, for all the Scholars spoke at once, and they were angry and frightened.

column2: A Street Sweeper!	A Street Sweeper!
column3: true

column2: A Street Sweeper walking in upon the World Council of Scholars!
column3: A Street Sweeper walking in upon the World Council of Scholars!

column2: It is not to be believed!
column3: It is not to be believed!

column2: It is against all the rules and all the laws!"
column3: It is against all the rules and all the laws!"

column2: But we knew how to stop them.
column3: But we knew how to stop them.

column2: Our brothers! we said.
column3: Our brothers! we said.

column2: We matter not, nor our transgression. It is only our brother men who matter.	We matter not, nor our transgression. It is only our brother men who matter.
column3: true

column2: Give no thought to us, for we are nothing, but listen to our words, for we bring you a gift such as [-had-] {+has+} never been brought to men.
column3: Give no thought to us, for we are nothing, but listen to our words, for we bring you a gift such as [-had ] {plus has plus} never been brought to men.

column2: Listen to us, for we hold the future of mankind in our hands."
column3: Listen to us, for we hold the future of mankind in our hands."

column2: Then they listened.
column3: Then they listened.

column2: We placed our glass box [-upon-] {+on+} the table before them.
column3: We placed our glass box [-upon ] {plus on plus} the table before them.

column2: We spoke of it, and of our long quest, and of our tunnel, and of our escape from the Palace of Corrective Detention.
column3: We spoke of it, and of our long quest, and of our tunnel, and of our escape from the Palace of Corrective Detention.

column2: Not a hand moved in that hall, as we spoke, nor an eye.
column3: Not a hand moved in that hall, as we spoke, nor an eye.

column2: Then we put the wires to the box, and they all bent forward and sat still, watching.
column3: Then we put the wires to the box, and they all bent forward and sat still, watching.

column2: And we stood still, our eyes upon the wire.
column3: And we stood still, our eyes upon the wire.

column2: And slowly, slowly as a flush of blood, a red flame trembled in the wire.
column3: And slowly, slowly as a flush of blood, a red flame trembled in the wire.

column2: Then the wire glowed.
column3: Then the wire glowed.

column2: But terror struck the men of the Council.
column3: But terror struck the men of the Council.

column2: They leapt to their feet, they ran from the table, and they stood pressed against the wall, huddled together, seeking the warmth of one another's bodies to give them courage.
column3: They leapt to their feet, they ran from the table, and they stood pressed against the wall, huddled together, seeking the warmth of one another's bodies to give them courage.

column2: We looked upon them and we laughed and said:
column3: We looked upon them and we laughed and said:

column2: Fear nothing, our brothers.	Fear nothing, our brothers.
column3: true

column2: There is a great power in these wires, but this power is tamed.
column3: There is a great power in these wires, but this power is tamed.

column2: It is yours.
column3: It is yours.

column2: We give it to you."
column3: We give it to you."

column2: Still they would not move.
column3: Still they would not move.

column2: We give you the power of the sky! we cried.
column3: We give you the power of the sky! we cried.

column2: We give you the key to the earth!	We give you the key to the earth!
column3: true

column2: Take it, and let us be one of you, the humblest among you.
column3: Take it, and let us be one of you, the humblest among you.

column2: Let us [-all-] work together, and harness this power, and make it ease the toil of men.
column3: Let us [-all ] work together, and harness this power, and make it ease the toil of men.

column2: Let us throw away our candles and our torches.
column3: Let us throw away our candles and our torches.

column2: Let us flood our cities with light.
column3: Let us flood our cities with light.

column2: Let us bring a new light to men!"
column3: Let us bring a new light to men!"

column2: But they looked upon us, and suddenly we were afraid.
column3: But they looked upon us, and suddenly we were afraid.

column2: For their eyes were still, and small, and evil.
column3: For their eyes were still, and small, and evil.

column2: Our brothers! we cried.
column3: Our brothers! we cried.

column2: Have you nothing to say to us?
column3: Have you nothing to say to us?

column2: Then Collective 0-0009 moved forward.
column3: Then Collective zero-o o o nine moved forward.

column2: They moved to the table and the others followed.
column3: They moved to the table and the others followed.

column2: Yes, spoke Collective 0-0009, "we have much to say to you."
column3: Yes, spoke Collective zero-o o o nine, "we have much to say to you."

column2: The sound of their [-voices-] {+voice+} brought silence to the hall and to [-be-] {+the+} beat of our heart.
column3: The sound of their [-voices ] {plus voice plus} brought silence to the hall and to [-be ] {plus the plus} beat of our heart.

column2: Yes, said Collective 0-0009, "we have much to say to a wretch who have broken all the laws and who boast of their infamy!
column3: Yes, said Collective zero-o o o nine, "we have much to say to a wretch who have broken all the laws and who boast of their infamy!

column2: How dared you think that your mind held greater wisdom [-that-] {+than+} the minds of your brothers?
column3: How dared you think that your mind held greater wisdom [-that ] {plus than plus} the minds of your brothers?

column2: And if the [-Councils-] {+Council+} had decreed that you [-should-] be a Street Sweeper, how dared you think that you could be of greater use to men than in sweeping the streets?"
column3: And if the [-Councils ] {plus council plus} had decreed that you [-should ] be a Street Sweeper, how dared you think that you could be of greater use to men than in sweeping the streets?"

column2: How dared you, gutter cleaner, spoke Fraternity 9-3452, "to hold yourself as one alone and with the thoughts of [-the-] one and not of [-the-] many?"
column3: How dared you, gutter cleaner, spoke Fraternity nine minus three thousand four hundred fifty two, "to hold yourself as one alone and with the thoughts of [-the ] one and not of [-the ] many?"

column2: You shall be burned at the stake, said Democracy 4-6998.
column3: You shall be burned at the stake, said Democracy four minus six thousand nine hundred ninety eight.

column2: No, they shall be lashed, said Unanimity 7-3304, "till there is nothing left under the lashes."
column3: No, they shall be lashed, said Unanimity seven minus three thousand three hundred four, "till there is nothing left under the lashes."

column2: No, said Collective 0-0009, "we cannot decide upon this, our brothers.
column3: No, said Collective zero-o o o nine, "we cannot decide upon this, our brothers.

column2: No such crime has ever been committed, and it is not for us to judge.
column3: No such crime has ever been committed, and it is not for us to judge.

column2: Nor for any small Council.
column3: Nor for any small Council.

column2: We shall deliver this creature to the World Council itself and let their will be done."
column3: We shall deliver this creature to the World Council itself and let their will be done."

column2: We looked upon them and we pleaded:
column3: We looked upon them and we pleaded:

column2: Our brothers!	Our brothers!
column3: true

column2: You are right.
column3: You are right.

column2: Let the will of the Council be done upon our body.
column3: Let the will of the Council be done upon our body.

column2: We do not care.
column3: We do not care.

column2: But the light?
column3: But the light?

column2: What will you do with the light?"
column3: What will you do with the light?"

column2: Collective 0-0009 looked upon us, and they smiled.
column3: Collective zero-o o o nine looked upon us, and they smiled.

column2: So you think [-that-] you have found a new power, said Collective 0-0009.
column3: So you think [-that ] you have found a new power, said Collective zero-o o o nine.

column2: Do {+you think+} all your brothers think that?
column3: Do {plus you think plus} all your brothers think that?

column2: No, we answered.
column3: No, we answered.

column2: What is not thought by all men cannot be true, said Collective 0-0009.
column3: What is not thought by all men cannot be true, said Collective zero-o o o nine.

column2: You have worked on this alone? asked International 1-5537.
column3: You have worked on this alone? asked International one minus five thousand five hundred thirty seven.
[-"Man ]

column2: {+"Yes," we answered.
column3: {plus"Yes," we answered.

column2: What is not done collectively cannot be good, said International 1-5537.
column3: What is not done collectively cannot be good, said International one minus five thousand five hundred thirty seven.

column2: Many+} men in the Homes of the Scholars have had strange new ideas in the past, said Solidarity 8-1164, "but when the majority of their brother Scholars voted against them, they abandoned their ideas, as all men must."
column3: Many plus} men in the Homes of the Scholars have had strange new ideas in the past, said Solidarity eight minus one thousand one hundred sixty four, "but when the majority of their brother Scholars voted against them, they abandoned their ideas, as all men must."

column2: This box is useless, said Alliance [-6-4349.-] {+6-7349.+}
column3: This box is useless, said Alliance [minus six minus four thousand three hundred forty nine.-] {plus six  seven three four nine.plus}

column2: Should it be what they claim of it, said Harmony 9-2642, "then it would bring ruin to the Department of Candles.
column3: Should it be what they claim of it, said Harmony nine minus two thousand six hundred forty two, "then it would bring ruin to the Department of Candles.

column2: The [-andle-] {+Candle+} is a great boon to mankind, as approved by all men.
column3: The [-andle ] {plus candle plus} is a great boon to mankind, as approved by all men.

column2: Therefore it cannot be destroyed by the whim of one."
column3: Therefore it cannot be destroyed by the whim of one."

column2: This would wreck the [-Plans-] {+plans+} of the World Council, said Unanimity 2-9913, "and without the Plans of the World Council the sun cannot rise.
column3: This would wreck the [-Plans ] {plus plans plus} of the World Council, said Unanimity two minus nine thousand nine hundred thirteen, "and without the Plans of the World Council the sun cannot rise.

column2: It took fifty years to secure the approval of all the Councils for the Candle, and to decide upon the number needed, and to re-fit {+the+} Plans so as to make candles instead of torches.
column3: It took fifty years to secure the approval of all the Councils for the Candle, and to decide upon the number needed, and to re fit {plus the plus} Plans so as to make candles instead of torches.

column2: This touched upon thousands and thousands of men working in scores of States.
column3: This touched upon thousands and thousands of men working in scores of States.

column2: We cannot alter the Plans again [-to-] {+so+} soon."
column3: We cannot alter the Plans again [-to ] {plus s o plus} soon."

column2: And if this should lighten the toil of men, said Similarity 5-0306, "then it is a great evil, for men have no cause to exist save in toiling for other men."
column3: And if this should lighten the toil of men, said Similarity five-o three o six, "then it is a great evil, for men have no cause to exist save in toiling for other men."

column2: Then Collective 0-0009 rose and pointed at our box.
column3: Then Collective zero-o o o nine rose and pointed at our box.

column2: This thing, they said, "must be destroyed."
column3: This thing, they said, "must be destroyed."

column2: And all the others cried as one:
column3: And all the others cried as one:

column2: It must be destroyed!
column3: It must be destroyed!

column2: Then we leapt to the table.
column3: Then we leapt to the table.

column2: We seized our box, we shoved them aside, and we ran to the window.
column3: We seized our box, we shoved them aside, and we ran to the window.

column2: We turned and we looked at them for the last time, and a rage, such as [-it-] is not fit for humans to know, choked our voice in our throat.
column3: We turned and we looked at them for the last time, and a rage, such as [-it ] is not fit for humans to know, choked our voice in our throat.

column2: You [-fools-] {+fools!"+} we cried.
column3: You [-fools-] {plus fools!"plus} we cried.

column2: You fools!	You fools!
column3: true

column2: You thrice-damned fools!"
column3: You thrice damned fools!"

column2: We swung our fist through the windowpane, and we leapt out in a ringing rain of glass.
column3: We swung our fist through the windowpane, and we leapt out in a ringing rain of glass.

column2: We fell, but we never let the box fall from our hands.
column3: We fell, but we never let the box fall from our hands.

column2: Then we ran.
column3: Then we ran.

column2: We ran blindly, and men and houses streaked past us in a torrent without shape.
column3: We ran blindly, and men and houses streaked past us in a torrent without shape.

column2: And the road seemed not to be flat before us, but as if it were leaping up to meet us, and we waited for the earth to rise and strike us in the face.
column3: And the road seemed not to be flat before us, but as if it were leaping up to meet us, and we waited for the earth to rise and strike us in the face.

column2: But we ran.
column3: But we ran.

column2: We knew not where we were going.
column3: We knew not where we were going.

column2: We knew only that we must run, run to the end of the world, to the end of our days.
column3: We knew only that we must run, run to the end of the world, to the end of our days.

column2: Then we knew suddenly that we were lying on a soft earth and that we had stopped.
column3: Then we knew suddenly that we were lying on a soft earth and that we had stopped.

column2: Trees taller than we had ever seen before stood over us in {+a+} great silence.
column3: Trees taller than we had ever seen before stood over us in {plus a plus} great silence.

column2: Then we knew.
column3: Then we knew.

column2: We were in the Uncharted Forest.
column3: We were in the Uncharted Forest.

column2: We had not thought of coming here, but our legs had carried our wisdom, and our legs had brought us to the Uncharted Forest against our will.
column3: We had not thought of coming here, but our legs had carried our wisdom, and our legs had brought us to the Uncharted Forest against our will.

column2: Our glass box lay beside us.
column3: Our glass box lay beside us.

column2: We crawled to it, we fell upon it, our face in our arms, and we lay still.
column3: We crawled to it, we fell upon it, our face in our arms, and we lay still.

column2: We lay [-this-] {+thus+} for a long time.
column3: We lay [-this ] {plus thus plus} for a long time.

column2: Then we rose, we took our [-box and-] {+box, had+} walked on into the forest.
column3: Then we rose, we took our [-box and ] {plus box, had plus} walked on into the forest.

column2: It mattered not where we went.
column3: It mattered not where we went.

column2: We knew that men would not follow us, for they never [-enter-] {+entered+} the Uncharted Forest.
column3: We knew that men would not follow us, for they never [-enter ] {plus entered plus} the Uncharted Forest.

column2: We had nothing to fear from them.
column3: We had nothing to fear from them.

column2: The forest disposes of its own victims.
column3: The forest disposes of its own victims.

column2: This gave us no fear either.
column3: This gave us no fear either.

column2: Only we wished to be [-away,-] away from the City and [-from-] the air that touches upon the air of the City.
column3: Only we wished to be [-away,-] away from the City and [-from ] the air that touches upon the air of the City.

column2: So we walked on, our box in our arms, our heart empty.
column3: So we walked on, our box in our arms, our heart empty.

column2: We are doomed.
column3: We are doomed.

column2: Whatever days are left to us, we shall spend them alone.
column3: Whatever days are left to us, we shall spend them alone.

column2: And we have heard of the corruption to be found in solitude.
column3: And we have heard of the corruption to be found in solitude.

column2: We have torn ourselves from the truth which is our brother men, and there is no road back for us, and no redemption.
column3: We have torn ourselves from the truth which is our brother men, and there is no road back for us, and no redemption.

column2: We know these things, but we do not care.
column3: We know these things, but we do not care.

column2: We care for nothing on earth.
column3: We care for nothing on earth.

column2: We are tired.
column3: We are tired.

column2: Only the glass box in our arms is like a living heart that gives us strength.
column3: Only the glass box in our arms is like a living heart that gives us strength.

column2: We have lied to ourselves.
column3: We have lied to ourselves.

column2: We have not built this box for the good of our brothers.
column3: We have not built this box for the good of our brothers.

column2: We built it for its own sake. It is above all our brothers to us, and its truth above their truth.
column3: We built it for its own sake. It is above all our brothers to us, and its truth above their truth.

column2: Why wonder about this?
column3: Why wonder about this?

column2: We {+have not many days to live.
column3: We {plus have not many days to live.

column2: We+} are walking to the fangs awaiting us somewhere among the great, silent trees.
column3: We plus} are walking to the fangs awaiting us somewhere among the great, silent trees.

column2: There is not a thing behind us to regret.
column3: There is not a thing behind us to regret.
